title: Little Britain's David Walliams and Matt Lucas confirm reunion
text:
It’s happening (Picture: Twitter)

After teasing fans David Walliams and Matt Lucas have finally confirmed they’re teaming back up for a Little Britain take on Brexit.

And we can hardly wait.

Last month Britain’s Got Talent judge David, 48, took to Twitter to upload a snap of himself and 45-year-old Matt, side-by-side for the first time in years.

Now we finally know what they were meeting about, as it was revealed tonight their latest project will focus on the current political endeavour of Brexit.

Taking to Twitter on Sunday night, Matt confirmed the reunion, as he posed with his former collaborator David, and the narrator of the iconic show, Tom Baker.

He captioned the amazing shot: ‘Join Matt Lucas & David Walliams for #LittleBrexit this Thursday at 6.30pm on BBC Radio 4.’

Join Matt Lucas & David Walliams for #LittleBrexit this Thursday at 6.30pm on BBC Radio 4 pic.twitter.com/nAe4EHShOU — Matt Lucas (@RealMattLucas) October 27, 2019

David also chimed in as he shared the same shot and wrote enthusiastically: ‘We are back back back! #LittleBrexit is on @BBCRadio4 on Thursday 31st of October at 6:30pm.’

Fans were obviously beside themselves as they commented, with so many sharing their applause for the reunion.

‘Most excellent news, a very welcome return in our hour of need,’ one wrote, as another added: ‘Oh yes please, I’ll be there.’

Beloved characters that listeners will be hearing from include Dafydd, Vicky Pollard, Emily Howard, Marjorie Dawes, Mr Mann, and Lou and Andy.

The star recently lifted the lid on plans to work with Matt again, after the pair reconciled last year, following a huge falling-out in 2011.

Little Britain’s characters caused controversy (Picture: Rex Features)

‘It has been great seeing much more of Matt. He is spending more time in the UK, so it has been a lot easier to see each other,’ he told The Sun.

‘We hope to do something together in the near future, but there is no immediate plan.’

Previously speaking about any potential reunion to the Big Issue, Bridesmaids star Matt said of the show’s controversial characters: ‘If I could go back and do Little Britain again, I wouldn’t make those jokes about transvestites. I wouldn’t play black characters.

‘Basically, I wouldn’t make that show now. It would upset people. We made a more cruel kind of comedy than I’d do now.

‘Society has moved on a lot since then and my own views have evolved. There was no bad intent there – the only thing you could accuse us of was greed.

‘We just wanted to show off about what a diverse bunch of people we could play.’

Little Brexit airs Thursday at 6.30pm on BBC Radio 4.
